name: Holiday Inn Express Boca Raton-West

reviews.text: Not nearly as nice as some of the Holiday Inn Express properties I've stayed at. Hotel was full (I saw them turn someone away), so we were in the older section of the hotel on the second floor. No elevator access to this section. I suspect this property barely passes the Holiday Inn Express minimum standards.
reviews.title: Older hotel. Rooms & breakfast OK. Not recently remodeled.

reviews.text: Nevertheless, good hotels are very expensive in this area, and at $162 inc. tax, I got pretty much what I expected. I would guess my room was redone over 6 years ago. It was quiet and clean enough and breakfast was fine.
reviews.title: An Okay Place in Central Boca

reviews.text: If you're picky, expect to pay more than $300 for a decent room in the Ft. Lauderdale, Boca, West Palm area.
reviews.title: Room substandard, front desk staff not helpful to resolve problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Holiday Inn Express is just west of the Florida Turnpike exit on Glades Road. Super convenient to that area, and practically across the street from a Starbucks.
reviews.title: There Is No Place Like Home

reviews.text: We had a room on the third floor in what has been called the "newer section" of the hotel. This section was actually new a long time ago, and has lost a bit of luster over the years. When I made the reservation three months in advance I requested two adjoining rooms on the fourth floor. Several times I was told that this request would be considered, but could not be guaranteed. When I checked in I got two rooms neither adjoining nor on the fourth floor. So much for their consideration.
reviews.title: Not bad!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights friendly staff decent breakfast.Quiet convenient location,rooms a bit dated but clean.Ideal for a short stay.
reviews.title: short stay
Business stay
reviews.text: Was ok, dated rooms. Just stayed one night. Staff was friendly. Looked like breakfast area was just put in a dark area.

I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for one night with my fiancee and mom to see my brothers robotics competition in Boca. We really had no complaints while staying there - the beds were comfy, bathroom super clean, air conditioning worked great, free breakfast was good, and they even had free cookies when you came in that were super yummy.
reviews.title: One night, no complaints

reviews.text: All in all, I think it's a great value and in a great location, especially for Boca Raton. There's also a fancy mall down the road that was quite entertaining to walk around - it's a big one!
reviews.title: Comfortable Space

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights here. It was a clean, comfortable room. Didn't notice any noise. Plenty of parking. Computer in the lobby was perfect for printing boarding passes. Nice breakfast. Plenty of seating. There is a burger king across the street. There are stores and restaurants to the left and a mall to the right when leaving the hotel.
reviews.title: Convenient for short stays

reviews.text: While the hotel was clean and convenient, as noted in the other reviews, I would not stay there again (unless I don't want to get any sleep). The wing we were in was ground level at the front of the hotel. There was lots of noise late at night from the parking lot outside (which the hotel staff did nothing about when we complained), in addition to the considerable traffic noise from Glades Avenue. The walls in this part of the motel must be very thin, as we heard all the "plumbing" noises from the adjacent rooms.
reviews.title: Noisy, noisy, noisy

reviews.text: Overall this was a fairly typical Holiday Inn Express, but somewhat run down and ready for refurbishing. My bathroom had moldy peeling wallpaper (approx 1 square foot was dangling and the back of it was black). It is a convenient location, with a pleasant lobby, decent beds and basic breakfast. The linens and towels were good. The toiletries were very basic but did the job. If it weren't for the wallpaper issue I would have rated this as a "4" or an average Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: Peeling moldy wallpaper in bathroom. Below average Holiday Inn Express

reviews.text: Very good stay. Right off exit 75 Turnpike. They honored a coupon from one of the magazines you get at the Turnpike's rest stop, and I ended up paying $69 a nite ($75 with tax). Super clean. Friendly front desk attendant. Safe area. Has a shopping center right next door, including a supernarket and a Marshalls and a Burger King right across. They are doing some kind remodeling though. However at the room I stayed (103, first floor), I did not hear any noise. The breakfast was great! Loved the variety, and very well presented, (6:30 to 10:30).
reviews.title: Good stay and right off the turnpike

reviews.text: I have a fantastic time here! The room is clean and the bed was very comfortable. We stayed for a night but the room was in such a great location that we decided that extend our stay a couple more nights.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: This is a nice, clean express hotel. It's reasonably priced. When traveling with kids, I look for clean and inexpensive. This is both. It's also such a short distance from the Turnpike, it's super convenient.
reviews.title: Great Turnpike Stop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Until a few years ago we had stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Boca West, Boca Raton, Florida at least once a year, and I'd reviewed it very favorably. After a few years when circumstances led to us staying in private accommodations nearby, we returned to this property for a week, and I can continue to recommend this property as a very good choice in the western Boca Raton area.
reviews.title: Still A Very Good Choice

reviews.text: I now rate it 4/5, not because it has dropped in quality, but because I believe standards have increased for properties in this category. (Actually, if it were available, I'd score it 4 1/2 out of 5.) The property continues to be very well maintained, and housekeeping/cleanliness continues to be excellent; so what, if anything, is missing? Well, the roomy units are still, as they were, very good, but nowadays travelers have generally increased their expectations in this level of lodging and most Holiday Inn Expresses, as well as most Hampton Inns and Fairfield Inns, as examples, seem to include an in-room refrigerator, microwave, and wired, as well as wireless, internet access, but the Holiday Inn Boca West offers only a refrigerator and only wireless internet. The refrigerator is one of the largest small refrigerators we've seen in a motel room, and while it does not include a freezer compartment, it was both quiet and effective. Only one ground floor ice machine serves the four story building, but that does make for less noise and foot traffic on floors 2-4. The HVAC in-room unit worked well and was unusually quiet, and all rooms have opening windows (or doors to balconies) which allow one to admit fresh air, which we consider a great, (and unfortunately increasingly rare,) advantage.
reviews.title: Bottom of the barrel

reviews.text: The breakfast is a fairly standard Holiday Inn Express offering, and the room and supplies were well-maintained.
reviews.title: Old Building.

reviews.text: Local and toll-free calls are free. Staff are generally pleasant and helpful, and cookies are on the reception desk each afternoon. The location is very convenient to the Glades Road exit of Florida's Turnpike and there are plenty of retail outlets and eateries close by, including some within walking distance.
reviews.title: Too few non-smoking rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you need accommodations near this exit of the Turnpike, or even from I-95 a bit further east, or in the vicinity of West Boca, including Century Village Boca West, this would be a very choice.
reviews.title: Confusion corrected!

aka: Holiday Inn Express Boca Raton-West Hotel
description: Take a Video Tour of the hotel. Stay Smart at the Holiday Inn Express Boca Raton West. We offer: Free Express Start breakfast bar, Free local calls and Priority Club Rewards benefits. We are situated in west Boca Raton at the Lakeside Shopping Center. Just 2 miles from Town Center Mall and 2 miles from the Evert Tennis Academy. Only 1 block west of the Florida Turnpike. Visit Boca Raton, FL and stay smart at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel.
